result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Email sent to ACJ advising def needs to be here in person on December 9;  ka
With Offer to Settle Attached
Sentencing hearing on December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:03 AM Defendant Tayler John Henry Pero in court, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court for Tayler John Henry Pero.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Cases 21CF230, 21CF232, 21CF233, 22CF42, 22CF43, and 22CF115.   Parties have agreement, request PSI, and both parties free to argue.  State has complied with victim rights.  Def understands charges and penalties.  22CF115, def waives right to have prelim, discussed with Atty, understands rights giving up.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Court has reviewed complaint, finds PC def committed felony in Ashland County, case bound over for arraignment.  State filing information now.  Atty, def waives reading.  Atty, def pleads NO CONTEST each of the charges in each of the cases, def agrees.  Each file contains a PLQ, understands rights giving up, information, and elements.  Def understands that he can still be ordered to be paid restitution of the DRI cases.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts NO CONTEST pleas.  As a factual basis can court rely on information in the complaints, parties agree.  Court finds factual basis exists and finds GUILTY, direct judgment to enter.  PSI ordered.  Def and Atty in person at sentencing hearing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Covers cases 21CF230, 21CF232, 21CF233 & New Charges. Defendant shall not possess any danderous weapons.
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
Defendant to have NO CONTACT with J.O., K.H., E.P., J.K., M.S., E.V., P.V., Superior Nails, J.B. & 914 Main St. West, Ashland WI, or C.H. & 407 Beaser Ave., Ashland WI.
